# init(nonretainedObject:)

**Initializer**

Creates a value object containing the specified object.

## Declaration

```swift
init(nonretainedObject anObject: Any?)
```

## Parameters

- **anObject**: The value for the new object.

## Return Value

A new value object that contains `anObject`.

## Discussion

This method is equivalent to invoking [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSValue/init(_:withObjCType:)] in this manner:

```objc
NSValue *theValue = [NSValue value:&anObject withObjCType:@encode(void *)];
```

This method is useful if you want to add an object to a [https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/General/Conceptual/DevPedia-CocoaCore/Collection.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/TP40008195-CH10] but don’t want the collection to create a strong reference to it.

## Working with Pointer and Object Values

- **init(pointer:)**: Creates a value object containing the specified pointer.
- **pointerValue**: Returns the value as an untyped pointer.
- **nonretainedObjectValue**: The value as a non-retained pointer to an object.
